subject: Re: [junit] time test passing, when the maximum time is '0'
msgSnippet: ... Putting a maximum time of 0 is meaningless, anyway, so why do you care? -- J. B. (Joe) Rainsberger Diaspar Software Services http://www.diasparsoftware.com
messageBody:
Harbir wrote:
>
>
> Hello Guys!!!
> I have a bit of problem here, the following the code of the
> performance test (time test) that using the Junitpref.
>
> If you look I have setted the "maxTime" for maximum time a test should
> take to '0', and still the green bar is showing up, i mean still the
> test is passing where as it should not be.

Putting a maximum time of 0 is meaningless, anyway, so why do you care?
--
J. B. (Joe) Rainsberger
Diaspar Software Services
http://www.diasparsoftware.com
Author, JUnit Recipes: Practical Methods for Programmer Testing
